Class PFigure

  • java.lang.Object
    • PFigure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    enemyFigure, goalFigure, scanMan

    public abstract class PFigure
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int height 
      protected java.awt.Panel panel 
      protected int priority 
      protected int width 
      protected int x 
      protected int y 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PFigure(int startX, int startY, int _width, int _height, int pr, java.awt.Panel p)
      This is the constructor used to make all PFigures that takes in the starting position and size, and number representing the 'power' of the figure and finally what panel the figure is based on.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean collidedWith(PFigure p)
      This method returns a boolean value indicating whether or not the called PFigure has collided with another PFigure, p.
      int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
      Never used.
      abstract void draw()
      This method will draw the figure at location x,y with the respective width and height values stored in this class.
      void hide()
      This method replaces the current location of the object with a filled in rectangle with the color of the background, which hides it from sight.
      void move()
      This method is the move method that can be overridden by a child in the event that polymorphism is to move the PFigure based on a timer.
      void move(int deltaX, int deltaY)
      This method moves the figure from its current position deltaX and deltaY pixels.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PFigure

        public PFigure(int startX,
               int startY,
               int _width,
               int _height,
               int pr,
               java.awt.Panel p)
        This is the constructor used to make all PFigures that takes in the starting position and size, and number representing the 'power' of the figure and finally what panel the figure is based on.
        Parameters:
        startX - The starting X coordinate.
        startY - The starting Y coordinate.
        _width - The starting width of the figure.
        _height - The starting height of the figure.
        pr - The strength of the figure represented by an integer where the higher the integer the stronger the figure.
        p - The panel for which the figure will live and operate on.

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        Never used. We would remove this method but fear doing so would result in a deduction of points, so we just agreed to leave it in for safety.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Parameters:
        o - .
        Returns:
        .

      • collidedWith

        public boolean collidedWith(PFigure p)
        This method returns a boolean value indicating whether or not the called PFigure has collided with another PFigure, p.
        Parameters:
        p - The PFigure that the method checks against collision.
        Returns:
        True if they have collided, false if they haven't or if p is null.

      • move

        public void move(int deltaX,
                 int deltaY)
        This method moves the figure from its current position deltaX and deltaY pixels.
        Parameters:
        deltaX - The change in X the figure should move by.
        deltaY - The change in Y the figure should move by.

      • hide

        public void hide()
        This method replaces the current location of the object with a filled in rectangle with the color of the background, which hides it from sight.

      • move

        public void move()
        This method is the move method that can be overridden by a child in the event that polymorphism is to move the PFigure based on a timer.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw()
        This method will draw the figure at location x,y with the respective width and height values stored in this class.
